intro: Elaeis guineensis subsp. nigrescens, commonly known as the African oil palm, is a member of the Arecaceae family and is native to West Africa. It is characterized by its tall, straight trunk and large, pinnate leaves that can reach several meters in length. The plant produces clusters of fruit within a spadix, which are encased in a fibrous苞. The fruit contains a fleshy outer layer and a hard inner shell with a kernel rich in oil. This subspecies is primarily cultivated for its oil-rich seeds, which are used in food and industrial applications.
